subject: Management
title: The Silo Effect
description: A 60-second lesson on The Silo Effect.

hook.text: Sony had engineers building three competing MP3 players. None of them knew about the others.

buildup.text: Silos form when departments optimize for their own goals at the expense of the whole.

discovery.text: Gillian Tett: silos cause duplication, missed opportunities, and organizational blind spots.

twist.text: Silos don't form from malice. They form from structure: separate budgets, metrics, and reporting lines.

climax.text: Share information by default. Create shared goals that require cross-department cooperation.

punchline.text: Silos are structural, not personal. Fix the structure.

quiz.question: What primarily causes organizational silos?
options: Structural factors like separate budgets, metrics, and reporting lines
Employees who intentionally refuse to share information
Having too many departments in the organization
